intro: Anoda abutiloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf abutilion, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Anoda abutiloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
